topics.body:
And Youtube just did what caused the fall of myspace.  They're getting too cocky.

What I mean by this is that recently youtube played off the financial threat of competitors by essentially going "we'll never lose popularity!" . .

What is happening right now is that a bunch of other sites are now introducing their own video services such as tumblr, facebook, etc because online videos have gotten cheap enough to host that pretty much everyone can do it.  In say ten years there won't just be youtube, but hundreds of websites that offer similar services and youtube just had to get cocky enough to believe they could never have competition.
